product_description.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
product_description.product_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Fresh concrete is placed on site or prefabricated, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with technical parameters such as high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes.

hazard_information.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

processes_included.upstream: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, electricity generation for A1 and A3
processes_included.core: External and internal transport, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), waste and wastewater treatment
processes_included.downstream: Distribution, installation, construction waste, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not included in EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_material_use: Recycled aggregate can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements
